paper_abstract: The determinantal complexity of a polynomial f(x (1),x (2),aEuro broken vertical bar,x (n) ) is the minimum m such that f=det (m) (L(x (1),x (2),aEuro broken vertical bar,x (n) )), where L(x (1),x (2),aEuro broken vertical bar,x (n) ) is a matrix whose entries are affine forms in the x (i) s over some field F Asymptotically tight lower bounds are proven for the determinantal complexity of the elementary symmetric polynomial of degree d in n variables, 2d-fold iterated matrix multiplication of the form aOE (c) u|X (1) X (2)aEuro broken vertical bar X (2d) |v >, and the symmetric power sum polynomial , for any fixed d > 1. A restriction of determinantal computation is considered in which the underlying affine map lambda x.L(x) must satisfy a rank lowerability property: L mapping to mxm matrices is said to be r-lowerable, if there exists an such that rank (L(a))a parts per thousand currency signm-r. In this model strongly nonlinear and exponential lower bounds are proved for several polynomial families. For example, for it is proved that the determinantal complexity using r-lowerable maps is Omega(n (d/(2d-r))), for constants d and r with 2a parts per thousand currency signd+1a parts per thousand currency signr < 2d. For r=2d-1 and d=aOESn (1/5-epsilon) aOE <, a lower bound is given for of magnitude , for any epsilon a(0,1/5).
paper_title: Lower Bounds for the Determinantal Complexity of Explicit Low Degree Polynomials
